Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Poster \Post"er\, n. 1. A large bill or placard intended to be posted in public places. [1913 Webster]
2. One who posts bills; a billposter. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Poster \Post"er\, n. 1. One who posts, or travels expeditiously; a courier. ``Posters of the sea and land.'' --Shak. [1913 Webster]
2. A post horse. ``Posters at full gallop.'' --C. Lever. [1913 Webster]

poster n 1: a sign posted in a public place as an advertisement; "a poster advertised the coming attractions" [syn: {posting}, {placard}, {notice}, {bill}, {card}] 2: someone who pastes up bills or placards on walls or billboards [syn: {bill poster}, {bill sticker}] 3: a horse kept at an inn or post house for use by mail carriers or for rent to travelers [syn: {post horse}]
